oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Small ruminant ophthalmology: The eyes have it
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, Mary C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sheep
goat
keratoconjunctivitis
entropion
ophthalmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Infectious keratoconjunctivitis (pinkeye) is a common problem in sheep and goats. Several etiologies as well as diagnostic techniques, treatment, and control are considered. Entropion is an important differential diagnosis, especially in young animals with eye irritation, and several inexpensive treatment methods are described. Additionally, causes of exophthalmosis, important causes of central blindness, and field enucleation are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 136-139
